articles.title: Total lockdown an option as Covid cases spike in Singapore this week; cases still high in South-East Asia - The Star Online
articles.description: South-East Asia reported 75,832 new Covid-19 cases on Friday, lower than Thursday’s 80,238. There were 1,390 fatalities, almost on par with the previous day’s 1,388.
articles.content: SINGAPORE/BANGKOK, Sept 11 (The Nation Thailand/ANN): South-East Asia reported 75,832 new Covid-19 cases on Friday, lower than Thursdays 80,238. There were 1,390 fatalities, almost on par with the pr… [+1163 chars]

articles.title: 'We are not reversing, but we are not racing ahead': Ong Ye Kung on plan to Covid-resilient nation - AsiaOne
articles.description: The rapid rise in Covic-19 infections over the last 18 days is not unexpected but is happening sooner than anticipated, Health Minister Ong Ye Kung said at the multi-ministry taskforce press conference on Friday (Sept 10), adding that Singapore should "naviga…

articles.title: 'Bigger than cats': Ang Mo Kio market's war on rodents sees authorities exterminate rats in 6-hour operation - AsiaOne
articles.description: [UPDATE Sept 11, 3pm] Ang Mo Kio Town Council told AsiaOne that during the overnight operation at Block 628 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 4 market on Thursday (Sept 9), one rat and two shrews were culled. No rat burrows were found. According to the National Environment A…

articles.title: ST report: Economic adviser position on the horizon for M'sia former premier Najib Razak - The Online Citizen Asia
articles.description: The Online Citizen Asia ST report: Economic adviser position on the horizon for M'sia former premier Najib Razak Malaysia
